results.title: Fashions in wool for '61
results.creator_credit: Frank Land and Australian Wool Corporation
results.brief_description: Depicts some of the winners in the Australian Wool Bureau’s Wool Fashion Awards for 1961. The fashions are modelled in various locations around Sydney. Commentary by Leonard Teale; photography by George Heath. The model is Pat Woodley.

results.title: Fasciola
results.brief_description: The life history of a nematode (the liver fluke), showing in detail its structure and its habits. The habits of the snail are then examined and shown to be a source of danger of infection. A detailed study of the life-cycle of the liver-fluke, showing the egg and the first larvae, the intermediate host - a snail, the second larvae, and, finally, the encysted third larvae, which are a source of infection to sheep, cattle, horses, dogs, and humans. The film shows that the most effective methods od dealing with fluke is to eliminate the conditions which are favourable for the breeding of the intermediate host, the snails. A gap is thereby created in the life-cycle of the fluke, as it cannot reproduce without the snails to act as intermediate host to the first larvae.

results.title: Farnborough International 1974
results.brief_description: The first International Farnborough Airshow. Europe’s top aerospace manufacturers announced that they had decided to work together for aircraft needs for the 1980s. The keynote was co-operation - from the Anglo-French Concorde and Jaguar to the European airbus.

results.title: Farnborough fly past (1955)
results.brief_description: The highlights of the 1955 Farnborough Air Show showing the latest developments in British civil and military aircraft. Aircraft appearing in the film include: the English Electric “P-1”, the first British aircraft to exceed the speed of sound in level flight; the Fairey “Delta II”, the Folland “Gnat I”, the new Hawker “Hunter F4”, the Fairey “Jet Gyrodyne” helicopter; and the de Havilland Gyron, claimed to be the most powerful type-tested engine yet announced.

results.title: Farnborough Air Show (1949)
results.brief_description: The Society of Aircraft Constructors’ Show at Farnborough, England, in 1949, is described in detail. The various types of new British aircraft are shown being put through their paces. Commentary by Leslie Mitchell.

results.title: Farmers of India: the Middle Ganges Valley
results.creator_credit: Victor Jurgens, Louis De Rochemont, Louis de Rochemont Associates and United Films
results.brief_description: Describes aspects of the life of an Indian family near Benares in the fertile Ganges Valley. The film shows methods of farming used in different seasons and emphasises the dependence of most Indians on the soil for their supply of food. Crop failure means starvation. A visit to the city of Benares is shown and the religious rituals observed at the sacred Ganges River are described. The film illustrates aspects of both country and city life in the Ganges Valley.

results.title: Farmers in business
results.creator_credit: Rae Evans, Anthony Isaacs, Cygnet Films and Rayant Pictures
results.brief_description: The role played by farmers’ co-operatives in the farming community: illustrated in particular by the progress of one flourishing society established in 1911, and operating in the border country of England and Scotland. Bulk buying and processing, communal marketing, depots for engineers and other supplies, agricultural pharmacies, and such specialised services as aerial spraying are among its many activities.

results.title: Farmer Charley
results.brief_description: One of the cartoon series featuring the character “Charley”. In this film Charley is willed a half-interest in a farm and has rosy dreams of rustic bliss, but the reality shows him that a farmer’s life requires expert knowledge and scientific skill - as well as good hard work.

results.title: The Farmer
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Dramatises the daily activities of a teenager and his young brother and sister, the children of a typical American farmer in the Midwest. The film pictures the farm as a modern, inviting, pleasant place on which to work and live.

results.title: Farewell to childhood
results.creator_credit: Julian Roffman, Herbert Kerkow and Mental Health Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows common problems of adolescents and their parents. A moody 15 year-old girl clashes with her parents when they frustrate her efforts to “run her own life”. Mistakes by the parents, such as scolding her in front of her young escort, widen the rift between parents and daughter. Conditions improve when the girl’s teacher arranges a thorough discussion of adolescent problems, bringing more tolerance to both sides.
